author: danceratopz
content:
Hey <@425274498732916736>, very nice! Thanks for sharing, it would certainly make sense to make them available to other teams. I'll discuss with the team, but I think we could readily add an evmone build to our fixture release CI flow and generate them there (perhaps from a known, tagged version of evmone?). Added to: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/issues/360

I'd suggest making the fixture names more verbose so that developers can locate the original unit test source more easily. And prefixing them with  `evmone`. In the next execution-spec-tests release, fixture names will correspond to the test file, function and parameters that generated the fixture, so it it can be located more easily, for example:
```
tests/berlin/eip2930_access_list/test_acl.py::test_access_list[fork_Berlin-blockchain_test]
```
I.e., `source_file::function_name[test_parameters]`

Just copying in the process here for others to follow along (please comment if I missed something):
```bash
export EVMONE_EXPORT_TESTS=exported_tests
build/bin/evmone-unittests --gtest_filter=state_transition.\*
ls exported_tests/state_transition/
# -> 
# block  create  eof  selfdestruct  trace  transient_storage  tx
```

author: chfast
content:
Yes, this is how it can be done. However, there are number of thing we can provide on our side.
1. We can create a fixture package on evmone's releases. So your part would be to download it and repackage.
2. We can also provide some docker images so you can generate with docker instead of building evmone.
